channel.title: CyberNetSec - Policy and Compliance
channel.description: Latest policy and compliance threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: FCC Warns Telecoms of 4x Increase in Ransomware, Urges Better Security
item.description:
The U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has issued a formal alert to the telecommunications industry regarding the escalating threat of ransomware. Citing data that shows a fourfold increase in attacks on the sector between 2022 and 2025, the FCC's Public Safety and Homeland Security Bureau...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Ransomware

item.title: Health-ISAC Report: AI-Enabled Attacks Named Top Threat to Healthcare Sector in 2026
item.description:
The Health Information Sharing and Analysis Center (Health-ISAC) has released its 2026 Global Health Sector Threat Landscape report, identifying AI-enabled attacks as the number one projected concern for the year. Based on surveys of healthcare executives and security professionals, the report highl...

item.title: UStrive Mentoring Platform Exposes Data of 238,000 Users, Including Minors, via Leaky API
item.description:
The non-profit mentoring platform UStrive has inadvertently exposed the sensitive personal data of over 238,000 users due to a misconfigured GraphQL API endpoint. A significant portion of the exposed user base includes minors, elevating the severity and privacy implications of the incident. The leak...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cybersecurity Risks Mount as Partial US Government Shutdown Begins
item.description:
A partial U.S. government shutdown began at midnight on January 31, 2026, after funding for several federal agencies, including the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), lapsed. Security experts are warning that such shutdowns create a period of heightened cybersecurity risk for the nation. With re...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Apple Boosts Privacy in iOS 26.3 with 'Limit Precise Location' Feature
item.description:
Apple has introduced a new privacy feature called 'limit precise location' in its iOS 26.3 update. This setting is designed to give users more control over their data by reducing the precision of location information shared with cellular networks. While carriers still receive location data for opera...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Mobile Security, Policy and Compliance

item.title: AI-Fueled Cyberattacks Surge by 70%, Check Point's 2026 Report Reveals
item.description:
Check Point's 14th annual Cyber Security Report highlights a dramatic escalation in the global threat landscape, revealing a 70% increase in cyberattacks since 2023. The 2026 report, analyzing trends from 2025, found that organizations faced an average of 1,968 attacks per week. A primary driver of ...

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Convergence of Identity and Data Security Creates New Attack Vectors, Netwrix Warns
item.description:
A new report from Netwrix warns that the next wave of cyber threats will arise from the convergence of identity and data security. As organizations increasingly rely on automated workflows to manage data access, attackers are shifting their focus from stealing individual credentials to exploiting mi...

item.title: Illinois DHS Exposes Data of 700,000 Residents in Massive Misconfiguration Breach
item.description:
The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) has disclosed a major data breach affecting approximately 705,000 state residents. The breach was caused by incorrect privacy settings on internal planning maps that were inadvertently made public on a mapping website for up to four years. The exposed...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

item.title: International Operation 'Echidna' Dismantles 'Crimson Market' Dark Web Hub, 50+ Arrested
item.description:
A coordinated international law enforcement action, codenamed 'Operation Echidna', has successfully dismantled 'Crimson Market', one of the largest dark web marketplaces for cybercrime tools and stolen data. The operation, involving the FBI, Europol, and the UK's NCA, resulted in the seizure of the ...

item.title: UK Advances New Bill to Regulate Managed Service Providers (MSPs)
item.description:
The United Kingdom government is advancing a new Cyber Security and Resilience Bill aimed at strengthening the nation's digital supply chain. A key provision of the bill is to bring Managed Service Providers (MSPs) under direct regulatory oversight for the first time. Citing the systemic risk demons...
